abstract: Appraisal column; study of New York city real estate prices over last 100 years finds strong connection between stock market and apartment prices; in 1930s, when sales dried up, rentals became popular.
snippet: A study of New York City’s real estate prices over the past 100 years found a strong connection between the stock market and apartment prices. In the 1930s, when sales dried up, rentals became popular.
lead_paragraph: A study of New York City’s real estate prices over the past 100 years found a strong connection between the stock market and apartment prices. In the 1930s, when sales dried up, rentals became popular.

headline.main: In an Earlier Time of Boom and Bust, Rentals Also Gained Favor
headline.print_headline: In an Earlier Time of Boom and Bust, Rentals Also Gained Favor
headline.seo: Rentals Gained Favor in an Earlier Boom-and-Bust Period - Appraisal
